Adjust axis label margins

Source: R/jamba-plots.r

Adjust axis label margins

adjustAxisLabelMargins(x, margin = 1, maxFig = 1/2, cex = NULL,
  prefix = "-- -- ", ...)

Arguments

x

vector of axis labels
margin

single integer value indicating which margin to adjust, using the order by par("mar"), 1=bottom, 2=left, 3=top, 4=right.
maxFig

fraction less than 1, indicating the maximum size of margin relative to the figure size. Setting margins too large results in an error otherwise.
cex

numeric or NULL, sent to strwidth when calculating the string width of labels in inches.
prefix

character string used to add whitespace around the axis label.
...

additional parameters are ignored.

Details

This function takes a vector of axis labels, and the margin where they will be used, and adjusts the relevant axis margin to accomodate the label size, up to a maximum fraction of the figure size as defined by maxFig. It currently assumes labels are placed perpendicular to the axis, e.g. las=2 when using text.

Note this function does not render labels in the figure.

Examples

xlabs <- paste0("item_", (1:20));
ylabs <- paste0("rownum_", (1:20));
adjustAxisLabelMargins(xlabs, 1);
adjustAxisLabelMargins(ylabs, 2);
nullPlot(xlim=c(1,20), ylim=c(1,20), doMargins=FALSE);
axis(1, at=1:20, labels=xlabs, las=2);
axis(2, at=1:20, labels=ylabs, las=2);

par("mar"=c(5,4,4,2));
adjustAxisLabelMargins(xlabs, 3);
adjustAxisLabelMargins(ylabs, 4);
nullPlot(xlim=c(1,20), ylim=c(1,20), doMargins=FALSE);
axis(3, at=1:20, labels=xlabs, las=2);
axis(4, at=1:20, labels=ylabs, las=2);
